definition: Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
Tartar/a tribe in China
(phonetic)/dressed leather
Tatar (person)
Strait of Tartary between Sakhalin and Russian mainland

sentences.english: The questions arising round Zubu and Tatar may be called a puzzle of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 阻卜与鞑靼之谜堪称一道世纪难题。

sentences.english: Yedisan Tatars traded there in the 14th century.
sentences.chinese: 十四世纪，东欧的鞑靼人在此从事贸易。

sentences.english: After the Tatars were defeated, Russia could turn against Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 在鞑靼人被击败后，露西亚可以转身对付瑞典。

sentences.english: The attack cleared the Tatars from the field, and continued the chase.
sentences.chinese: 这次袭击从战场上清除了鞑靼人，并继续追击。

sentences.english: Tatars no longer dared attack the southern Russian border and in 1598 also made a peace with Russia.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼人再也不敢袭击露西亚南部边境。

sentences.english: In total, during the 16th century Crimean Tatars invaded Russia 91 times.
sentences.chinese: 16世纪期间，克里木鞑靼入侵露西亚总共91次。

sentences.english: The Tartars employed another weapon, the so-called Chinese dragon belching fire.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼人使用了另一种武器，所谓中国龙喷火器。

sentences.english: Despite being sacked and burnt by the invading Tartars in the next century.
sentences.chinese: 尽管在十三世纪里历经了鞑靼人入侵的劫掠和烧毁。

sentences.english: Sometimes also used the Pan- Tatar said all ethnic groups in northern China.
sentences.chinese: 有时也用鞑靼泛称中国北方各民族。

sentences.english: Tartar evolutions are indicated by flags which are lowered, like marine signals.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼人变阵是通过旗帜的降低来表示，就像海事信号。

sentences.english: During this period the Russian steak tartare was brought back to Germany and called "tartare steak."
sentences.chinese: 这个时候，德国人就把俄罗斯的鞑靼牛排带回了德国。

sentences.english: Steak tartare is really light it's like eating sushi.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼牛排是很清淡的食物，就像寿司一样。

sentences.english: We went from the country of the Tartars into the country of those who curse the Moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们从鞑靼来到了一个诅咒月亮的国度。

definition: Mongolia
Tatar (person)
Oirat Mongols (alliance of tribes of Western Mongolia) (Ming Dynasty term)
Mongol
Turkic ethnic group
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
khanate (Mongol state)
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
Khalkha, largest subgroup of Mongol people
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
khan (loanword)
